meanings.definition: Of or relating to light, especially ultraviolet light.
meanings.sent1: The actinic rays of the sun can cause sunburn.
meanings.sent2: She wore special glasses to protect her eyes from actinic light.
meanings.sent3: The actinic flashlight made everything glow in the dark.
meanings.sent4: The actinic glow of the fireflies lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The actinic properties of the light made the experiment successful.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to cause chemical changes when exposed to light.
meanings.sent1: The actinic chemicals reacted quickly under the lamp.
meanings.sent2: The actinic solution turned blue when exposed to light.
meanings.sent3: The actinic paint changed color in the sunlight, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: The actinic reaction in the beaker produced a puff of smoke.
meanings.sent5: The actinic nature of the substance made it perfect for photography.

meanings.definition: A substance that is sensitive to light and undergoes a chemical change.
meanings.sent1: The photographer used actinic to develop the film.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the properties of the actinic in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The actinic in the bottle reacted as soon as it was exposed to light.
meanings.sent4: The artist used actinic to create a unique painting technique.
meanings.sent5: The actinic in the solution made it perfect for light-sensitive applications.
